docreader.list

Class SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer

  • java.lang.Object
    • docreader.list.SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer>
    Enclosing class:
    SublistManager

    private static final class SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer>
    Determines formatting properties of a paragraph necessary for correct inclusion into a list hierarchy with respect to any possible list formatting overrides
    Author:
    Moritz Dorka

    • Method Detail

      • getOverriddenLeftIndentationFirstLine

        public int getOverriddenLeftIndentationFirstLine()
        Get the left indentation of the first line of this paragraph.

        For list paragraphs (i.e. those where getListType() is set) this describes the left indent of the numberText.

        Returns:
        true left indentation of the first line with respect to any possible overrides.

      • getOverriddenLeftIndentationParagraph

        public int getOverriddenLeftIndentationParagraph()
        Get the left indent of lines n>1 of this paragraph.

        For list paragraphs (i.e. those where getListType() is set) this describes the left indent of the text of the current item. For ordinary paragraphs it is just the indent of the second line and all lines thereafter.

        Returns:
        true left indentation of the actual paragraph with respect to any possible overrides.

      • getOverriddenOutlineLevel

        public int getOverriddenOutlineLevel()
        Returns:
        true outline level of a list paragraph with respect to any possible overrides

      • isLeftIndentationAvailable

        public boolean isLeftIndentationAvailable()
        Note: This method mainly exists due to a bug in POI (or Word?; who knows...) which results in 0 as the dxaleft-value despite the paragraph being indented.
        Hence, this is a slightly more thorough test to avoid such pitfalls.
        Returns:
        true if a left indentation has been found; otherwise false

      • setFakeListStatus

        public void setFakeListStatus(boolean status)
        Parameters:
        status - true if this paragraph is part of a fake list; false otherwise

      • setNoIndentation

        public void setNoIndentation()
        Force the determiner to not have any indentation; used for messed up formatting; will result in a paragraph at the least possible significance level

      • isUnnumbered

        public boolean isUnnumbered()
        Determines if the list number of the last processed paragraph is not unique by itself (i.e. we have a bulleted or unnumbered list or no list number at all)
        Returns:
        true if the number of the last processed paragraph needs a number appendix; false otherwise

      • getListType

        public SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer.ListType getListType()
        Returns:
        true if the paragraph represented by this object is part of a list; false otherwise

      • compareTo

        @DomainSpecific
public int compareTo(SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer pProperties)
        Determine the list level significance of this instance compared to another SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<SublistManager.ParagraphPropertiesDeterminer>
        Returns:
        One of the following values:
        -1
        more significant
        0
        equally significant
        1
        less significant
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

      • getLeftIndentAvailability

        private static boolean getLeftIndentAvailability(int leftIndentationParagraph,
                                                 int leftIndentationFirstLineRelative)
        Parameters:
        leftIndentationParagraph - left indentation of the entire paragraph
        leftIndentationFirstLineRelative - relative left indentation of the first line of the paragraph
        Returns:
        true if a left indent is available; otherwise false

      • getAbsoluteFirstLineIndent

        private static int getAbsoluteFirstLineIndent(int leftIndentationParagraph,
                                              int leftIndentationFirstLineRelative)
        Parameters:
        leftIndentationParagraph - left indentation of the entire paragraph
        leftIndentationFirstLineRelative - relative left indentation of the first line of the paragraph
        Returns:
        absolute left indent of the first line in this paragraph
